result.execSummary:
The defendant Mathew E. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mathew E. Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mathew E. Smith was found guilty of Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh. [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Mathew E. Smith was found guilty of Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh. [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Mathew E. Smith was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:14 p.m. Defendant Mathew E. Smith in court with attorney David Vernon Penn.  Defendant Mathew E. Smith in custody.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf278 and 15cm222. Also calling 17cf272, 16cm342, 16cm172, 17cf272, 16CT39. 
In 15cf278 and 15cm222 - Penn states he is still counsel on revocation matters. Parties in receipt of revocation packets. Sowinski/Penn/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
15cf278
Count 1
Jail - 9 months - CS to 15cm244

Count 2 
6 months - CC to Count 1; CS 15cm244


15cm222
Count 1
Jail - 6 months - CS to 15cf278

Count 2
Jail - 6 months - CC to Count 1 and CS to 15cf278

Count 3
Jail - 3 months - CS to Counts 1 and 2

Court takes judicial notice of 15cm244 - since sentences are consecutive - no additional time served is entitiled in these matters. Court speaks to defendant's letter re time served. 
Any financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment. Appeal rights given.

Court grants Motion to Withdraw effective upon the date new counsel is obtained. Status conference scheduled for Monday, February 19, 2018 at 3:30 p.m. Attorney Penn is excused from appearance if new counsel has not been appointed. 

Penn moves for modification of bond; Defendant statement to no contact provision while at jail. Court explains no contact bond provision. 
Adj. 3:49 p.m.
Striking document filed by defendant
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 25, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
from defendant regarding jail credit
includes revocation summary and cover letter

records.addlTxt: Defendant/Judge
Pre Trial Conference on 8-11-15

3:28 Defendant Mathew E. Smith in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Mathew E. Smith in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15fo625, 15tr1067, 15cm244, 15cf180, 15cm222, 15tr1449, 15cm250. Victim impact statement filed. State moves to dismiss Case No. 15cf180 and 15cm250 - Granted. Voorhees just received Amended Complaint in 15cm222 - requests adjournment to review. Adj. 3:33 p.m.
3:34 p.m. Voorhees statement to Amended Complaint. State moves to dismiss Count 4 of 15cm222 - Granted. State moves to dismiss 15fo625 and 15tr1067 - Granted. Defendant pleads no contest. Plea questionaire filed.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Vorhees/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing. State moves for JOC reflect jail credit for time served- Granted.
Court sentence - all counts concurrent

WHS/POP 3 yrs.
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
Community Service - 50 hours to be completed within first year of probation
Restitution in the amount of $82.50 (includes 10%)
AODA assessment and recovery
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Count 1 in 15cm244 - Jail - 90 days with Huber for all purposes; Jail credit - 55 days 
Special disposition under 973.015 if successful completion of probation and payment of all costs/restitution
The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Probation to collect 15tr1449 fines (balance $225.50) as a courtesy.
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 4:03 pm

1:41 p.m. Defendant Mathew E. Smith in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm222, 15cm250, 15cf180, 15fo625, 15tr1067 and 15tr1449 (Review). Case 15cf180 - intra circuit transfer from Branch 1 has not yet occurred. Adj. 1:47 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 11:30 am. 1:48 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery and State's Demand for Discovery

03:25 pm - Defendant Mathew E. Smith in court, via video,  with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15fo625, 15cm222, 15cm244 and 15cm250.     15cm250 - In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea entered - Intra Circuit to BR II.  In 15cm244, BR I case, set for PTC 8-11-15 at 2 pm.  Set BR II cases 15cm250 and 15cm222 for PTC 8/4/15 at 01:30 pm 
Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Adjourned 03:40 p.m.
No contact with Cassandra Beatty except for purposes of employment only at McDonalds

02:54 pm - Defendant Mathew E. Smith in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf104 (PH), 15tr1067 and 15cm222 (Initial).  State moves to dismiss 15cf104 with the understanding that 15cm222 is now filed with the correct charges.  Court grants motion to dismiss 15cf104.  In 15cm222 -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea.  Michlig/Voorhees to bond.  Court sets sig bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
